children.name: time when you travel for enjoyment
honeymoon
children.definition: the holiday that a man and a woman have just after they are married: tuần trăng mật
examples: We had our honeymoon in Majorca.
on honeymoon
Where are you going on honeymoon?
on your honeymoon
We went to Italy on our honeymoon.
Where are you going on your honeymoon?
second honeymoon[C usually S] humorous a holiday taken by a husband and wife who have been married for some time, especially in order to try to improve a relationship which is failing

children.name: holiday
children.definition: 1UK(alsos) a time of rest from work, school etc : nghỉ làm, nghỉ việc
examples: The school holidays start tomorrow.
on holiday
I’m away on holiday until the 1st of June.
in the holidays
He came to stay with us in the school holidays.
holiday from
a holiday from her usual responsibilities

RegisterIn everyday British English, when sb is temporarily away from their work or studies, people often say they areoff, rather thanon holiday. Note, however, thatoffcan also mean that sb is away from their work or studies because they are sick:
‘Where’s Kate?’ ‘She’soffthis week.’
2[C or U]UK(alsoholidays) a period of time when you travel to another place for pleasure : kỳ nghỉ
We’re going to Spain for our holidays.
on holiday
He caught malaria while on holiday in Africa.
I haven’t had a proper holiday for two years.
Grammar : Holidaysis usually used after 'the', 'my', 'your' etc when it refers to a single period when you are travelling or are not working or studying :
Soon it will be the holidays.
Where do you want to go for your holidays?
go on holidayThe children were excited about going on holiday.
have/take a holidayTeachers cannot take holidays during term time.
book a holidayI booked the holiday online.
a skiing/camping/walking etc holidayThey went on a camping holiday in France.
a package holiday(= a holiday in which you pay a price that includes travel, room, and food )The company organizes package holidays to Spain and Greece.
a summer holidayThey were going to a house on the coast for their summer holidays.
a winter holidayWhy not try a winter holiday for a change?
a family holidayI first visited Orkney on a family holiday when I was a boy.
an annual holiday(= a holiday you take every year )We were getting ready for our annual holiday in Cornwall.
your dream holiday(= the best holiday you can imagine )They won a dream holiday for two to the Caribbean.
a holiday resort(= a place with many hotels where a lot of people go on holiday )a holiday resort in Spain
a holiday destination(= a town or country where a lot of people go on holiday )Marmaris is one of Turkey's most popular holiday destinations.
a holiday brochure(= a magazine that shows what holidays you can take )We were looking through holiday brochures thinking about the summer.
holiday photos(alsoholiday snapsinformal) (= photographs that you take when you are on holiday )Do you want to see our holiday snaps?
a holiday romance(= a brief romantic relationship with someone you meet on holiday )It was just a holiday romance; I never saw him again.
a holiday abroad(= a holiday in a country other than the one you live in )They were planning a holiday abroad that year.
the holiday of a lifetime(= a very good or expensive holiday that you will only take once )We took the family on a holiday of a lifetime to Orlando, Florida.

children.name: cruise
children.definition: a holiday during which you travel on a largeboatthat has entertainment, restaurants, swimming pools etc:chuyến du lịch trên tàu
examples: The seven-day cruise stops at Cabo San Lucas, Puerto Vallarta and other Mexican resorts.
a Mediterranean cruise
cruise around
a cruise around the world
go on a cruiseWhat about going on a cruise down the Nile?
take a cruiseWe thought about taking a ten-day cruise in the Caribbean.
a luxury cruiseHe went on a luxury cruise to Alaska.
a Mediterranean/Caribbean etc cruisea 15-night Mediterranean cruise
a world cruise(= around the world )How much would a world cruise cost?
a cruise ship/linera luxury cruise ship
a cruise line/operator(= company that provides cruises )

children.name: vacation
children.definition: especially USa holiday, or time spent not working :
examples: We're planning a vacation in Europe.
on vacation
He's on vacation this week.
We're planning to go on vacation soon.
take/have a vacationWe usually take a vacation once a year.
go on vacationI'm going on vacation next month.
need a vacationYou're working too hard. You need a vacation.
spend a vacationWhere did you spend your vacation?
a summer vacationWhat did you do on your summer vacation?
a family vacationWe had to cancel the family vacation.
a long vacationShe decided to take a long vacation.
a short vacationa short vacation at the beach
a two-week/three-day etc vacation
a vacation spot(= a place for a vacation )The island is my favorite vacation spot.
a vacation day(= a day away from work on vacation )You could take a sick day or a vacation day.
vacation plans(= an idea about what you want to do on your vacation )Do you have any vacation plans this summer?
COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'have vacation'. Saybe on vacation.

children.name: to go for a holiday swh
go on holiday
children.definition: British /go on vacationAmerican  to go away from your home, especially for a holiday: đi nghỉ
examples: We used to go on holiday in Scotland when we were kids
Make sure you get insurance before you go on holiday.
Most families go on vacation during the summer.

children.name: go away
children.definition: to go away from your home, especially for a holiday: đi nghỉ
examples: We’re going away for two weeks in June.
Martha and Tom are going away this weekend.
We usually go away for the summ
He goes away on business a lot.

children.name: get away
children.definition: to spend time away from your home - use this especially about sb who goes on holiday for a rest from their normally busy life:đi nghỉ
examples: We managed to get away for a week in August.
I just need to get away for a few days.
get away from it allspend time away from all the things you usually have to do
Yosemite is a great place to get away from it all.
We've decided to go to Scotland to get awayfrom it all.

children.name: take off U
children.definition: take offUSinformalto go on holiday, especially somewhere exciting or far away:đi xa
examples: take off for
Carlos just took off for Venezuela for three weeks.

children.name: resort
children.definition: a place where a lot of people go for a holiday, especially one that has a lot of things specially provided for tourists such as hotels, swimming pools, organized activities etc:khu nghỉ mát
examples: Aspen, a ski resort in Colorado
Lagoon Reef is one of the best resort hotels.
a tourist resortThere are plans to turn the town into a tourist resort.
a seaside/beach resortWe stayed in a relaxed beach resort on the east coast.
a mountain resortmountain resorts in Colorado
a lakeside resortthe popular lakeside resort of Lake Como
a holiday resortBenidorm is a terrific holiday resort.
a ski resortThe lack of snow is causing problems for ski resorts.
a health resortWe booked ourselves into a health resort for a weekend of pure indulgence.
a popular resortThe popular seaside resort of Brighton is 40 minutes away.
a lively resortIt is a lively resort with plenty of bars and cafés.
a bustling resort(= lively and full of people )The hotel is right in the middle of this bustling resort.
a fashionable resortHastings was a once fashionable resort.
a resort town/area/centreThey're only a five minute stroll away from the main resort centre with all its bars, restaurants and nightlife.
a resort hotelThere are plans for a major resort hotel and golf course to be built.
a resort complex(= a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts )Club Hotel is part of a resort complex offering a range of facilities.

children.name: tourist destination
children.definition: a place where a lot of people like to go on holiday:điểm đến du lịch
examples: Amsterdam is the Netherlands’ most popular tourist destination.
Phuket is an international tourist destination 430 miles south of Bangkok.

children.name: tourist trap
children.definition: disapproving a place that a lot of tourists go to, but where hotels, food, gifts etc are moreexpensivethan they should be, and that is often not as pleasant or interesting as tourists expect:khu du lịch đắt đỏ,nơi bóc lột khách du lịch
examples: Residents are worried that the president’s home town will turn into a tourist trap.

children.name: the sights
children.definition: famous or interesting places that tourists visit :
examples: We spent a fortnight in Rome looking at all the sights.
In the afternoon, you’ll have a chance to relax orsee the sights.
the sights of
So, Maria’sshowingyouthe sightsof Copenhagen, is she?

children.name: tourism
children.definition: the business of providing things for people to do, places for them to stay etc while they are on holiday - use this especially when you are talking about all the services tourists need, such as hotels, food etc:du lịch
examples: As part of a plan to increase tourism, visitors staying less than 90 days do not need a visa.
The country relies on tourism and the sale of raw materials for hard currency.
Tourism is Venice's main industry.
These beautiful old towns have remained relatively untouched by tourism.
The country depends on tourism for much of its income.

children.name: ecotourism
children.definition: the business of organizing holidays to places that people do not usually visit in a way which helps local people and does not damage the environment : du lịch sinh thái

children.name: agritourism
children.definition: the business of providing holidays for tourists on farms or in the countryside : du lịch sinh thái

children.name: self-catering
children.definition: UK(of a holiday) having a kitchen so that you can cook meals for yourself rather than having them provided for you : tự làm bữa ăn
examples: a self-catering holiday
We decided to go for self-catering rather than stay in a hotel.

children.name: the season
children.definition: the time of year when a tourist area is busy and a lot of people go there:mùa cao điểm
examples: The season begins in May, and most of the hotels open then.
This place gets so crowded during the season. It’s much nicer in the winter when the tourists have gone.
the holiday/summer/tourist, etc seasonthe period when most people take their holidays, go to visit places or take part in an activity outside work
Air fares are more expensive during the holiday season.
high season/low seasonwhen a place is busiest or least busy
They put their prices up considerably during the high season.
People on limited budgets should avoid travellingin/during/UKathigh season if they can.

children.name: out of season
children.definition: in the off-season/UK  if you go to a tourist area in the off-season or out of season, you go there during that part of the year when it is not busy and is usually cheaper: ngoài mùa nghỉ
examples: We had arrived in Biarritz out of season and most of the hotels were closed.
If you go for a holiday in the off-season, you’ll find some real bargains.
during the off-season
During the off-season, rates start at $75 per night for a cabin that sleeps two.

children.name: in season
children.definition: at the time of year when many people want to travel or have a holiday: vào mùa nghỉ
examples: Hotel rooms are more expensive in season.
Don’t travel to Benidorm in season. The hotels are crowded.

children.name: guidebook
children.definition: a book which gives information for visitors about a place, such as a city or country : sách hướng dẫn cho du khách
examples: travel guidebooks
a guidebooktoMontreal

children.name: travel agent
children.definition: sb who owns or works in a travel agency: đại lý du lịch
examples: Check with your travel agent for the best rates.
travel agency[C] a company that arranges hotel rooms, plane tickets etc for people who want to travel : đại lý du lịch

children.name: tour guide
children.definition: sb who leads a tour to different places and tells people about their history, meaning etc:hướng dẫn viên du lịch
examples: Student tour guides take visitors on a one-hour tour of the campus.
According to our tour guide, Gibraltar is the largest fortress in the world.
guide[C] A2 a person whose job is showing a place or a particular route to visitors : hướng dẫn viên
We hired a guide to take us up into the mountains.
atourguide
an experiencedmountain guide

children.name: tourist office
children.definition: an office that supplies information to people who are visiting an area for pleasure or interest : văn phòng tư vấn du lịch
examples: touristinformationoffice
The local touristinformationoffice provides a free map of the region.

children.name: attraction
children.definition: sth which makes people want to go to a place to see:
examples: The beautiful beaches are the island’smain attraction
Life in London has so many attractions – nightclubs, good restaurants and so on.
the main attractionThe lovely countryside is obviously the main attraction for visitors.
the star attraction(= someone or something that many people want to see )The former President was the star attraction of the conference.
a popular attractionThe zoo is by far the most popular attraction.
a big/major attractionThe ducks and geese are a big attraction to children.
a special attractionA special attraction is the tropical greenhouse.
a tourist attraction[C] a place that many tourists want to see: điểm du lịch
Graceland, Elvis Presley’s former home, is now a tourist attraction that draws more than 600,000 visitors every year.
The British Museum is one of London’s most popular tourist attractions.
a visitor attractionThe park will be a new visitor attraction for the town.
be/become/prove/hold an attraction
The organisers hope the event will become an annual attraction.
Skiingholdsno attractionforme.
